page.title: 03Housing in Auchtermuchty
page.content: The old cottages were built with stones. They had{slate}roofs or {thatched}roofs or{red pantiled}roofs with crow-stepped gables which are like little steps up the side of the roof. Many of these cottages were occupied by{weavers.}There are also {marriage lintels}above the doors. The oldest house is{Macduff House}which is about 500 years old. Many modernised houses retain the old character. The council housing schemes include{ {Stratheden Place, North Park, {Lochiebank Crescent, Pitmedden {Wynd, Lomond Court, Jubilee Court, {Burnside Terrace, Lochybank Terrace {and Macduff Place. The newer council housing schemes are{Westland Park and The Riggs. {Provost Park and Westbank}are new private housing areas.
